choices: Ryan sees a scaly patch on his arm
Ryan is purple bug with wings and yellow stripes
1.content:
As Ryan stood in the shade of a large oak, he felt a sharp pain on his forearm. He looked down and saw a weird purple bug with wings and yellow stripes.

Even as he watched, the bug bit him a second time. Ryan, not wanting a third bite, raised his hand and slapped the bug.

He lifted his hand and saw the pulverized remains of the weird insect.

"Too bad," he said. The bug would have been a good one for his students to collect.

He gazed into the meadow and saw his students waving their mesh nets wildly in the tall grass.

He meant to relax in the shade until he began to feel dizzy. His entire arm itched. He looked down and saw the bug bite looked red.

"What's happening?" Ryan asked as his head began to spin.

In an instant, he fainted.

Some time later, Ryan began to wake.
1.title: Bitten

choices: Ryan uses his wings to fly
12.content:
Ryan, feeling groggy, began to awake.

He felt very strange. His body felt almost weightless.

He went to rub his eyes, but his body reacted strangely. He felt an odd twitching atop his head and a similar sensation on his back.

He wondered what had happened.

He heard an excited voice. He recognized the voice as belonging to Jeremy, one of his students.

"Nathan! Look at this one!"

"Cool!"

"It's purple with wings and yellow stripes!"

"Catch it!" Jeremy shouted.

Ryan meant to warn the boys that the strange bug could bite.

But, when he scanned for them, he met a shocking sight.

The boys looked gigantic.

Ryan tried to ascertain what had happened. His whole world looked enormous.

He turned back toward the boys and tried to speak.

His mouthparts scraped together, but he could produce no words.

Mouthparts!

He felt panic build. "I'm a bug!" Ryan realized.

He looked up toward his huge students and saw them approaching with huge butterfly nets.

"Oh no! I'm a bug and they're trying to collect me!"
12.title: The Hunt Begins

121.content:
"I've got to get away from them!" With that thought foremost in his head, the transformed teacher felt the most curious sensation on his back.

"My wings!" Ryan thought, amazed as the new appendages began to open and flap. Before he even realized what he was doing, the teacher-turned-bug launched himself into the air.

Although mortified by his transformation into insect form, Ryan felt oddly exhilarated as he flew through the air.

Almost convinced he could grow accustomed to flight, he looked down and saw his students, Jeremy and Nathan, standing below.

He also saw something else.

"Oh no!" Ryan thought and tried to veer away from the enormous youngsters.

A second later he collided with a wall of sheer fabric and tumbled into a deep tunnel.

He heard the animated conversation pass between Jeremy and Ryan.

"I got it!" Jeremy said proudly.

"Way to go!" Nathan said.

Stuck in the net, the little bug attempted to dislodge itself from the fine mesh. Jeremy gave the net a vigorous shake and watched the strange insect tumble to the bottom of the deep net.

"Do you have the cage?" Jeremy asked.

"Yeah," Nathan replied.
121.title: Brief Flight

choices: The boys keep searching for their teacher
The boys decide to hunt more bugs
1211.content:
Ryan watched with despair as Jeremy's big fingers plucked him from the net.

Nathan held open the lid of a plastic cage, which allowed Jeremy to make the transfer from net to cage in no more than an instant.

The entire process left their transformed teacher bewildered and horror-struck as he surveyed the confines of the plastic prison.

As he tried to think, a loud tapping interrupted.

Nathan tapped on the plastic cage. "What kind of bug is it?"

"Let's find Mr. Dalton and ask him," Jeremy responded.

The cage swayed in Nathan's hand as the boys looked for their teacher. They shouted his name.
1211.title: Into the Cage

12112.content:
Ryan Dalton, a sixth-grade teacher at an all-boys academy, never imagined a field trip to collect insects could go so horribly wrong.

Now, the transformed teacher, trapped as a weird bug, has been collected and caged by two of his own students. Even as they call for their teacher to show them their captive bug, Ryan remains unable to communicate with them.

He scrambled around the plastic collection cage, unsure of his footing now that he had six legs.

"Boys," he tried to scream. "Help! Let me out!"

"Forget about finding Mr. Dalton," Jeremy suggested. "Let's find some more bugs."

Nathan tapped on the plastic walls of the cage. "Yeah. This little bug looks like he wants some company," he said.
12112.title: Looking for More Bugs

121122.content:
"Boys!" Ryan tried to scream. "Let me out! There's been a mistake. I'm no bug!"

For all intents and purposes, however, that's exactly what the unfortunate grade school teacher had become ' a tiny bug collected by two of the boys he had been supervising for a class field trip. Trapped inside a collection cage carried by Nathan, the transformed teacher remained helpless to communicate his dilemma to his students, now engaged in the hunt for more insects to add to the cage.

The prospect of sharing his limited space with any other bugs unnerved the teacher-turned-insect.

The boys with their mesh nets approached a vast field. Inside the cage, which was constantly shaken as they moved, their teacher attempted to think of some plan of action.

Not much time passed before Jeremy succeeded in capturing a bug in his net. Nathan stood next to his friend. "I'll open the cage," he said. "You drop it inside."

Ryan listened. Should he make a bid for freedom? He might not get another chance.
121122.title: Freedom Bid

1211221.content:
Ryan tried to anticipate the actions of the two sixth-grade boys, but he hadn't quite adjusted to his new insect body.

He tried to use his wings to fly out of the cage when Nathan opened the cage, but Jeremy dropped the new bug into the cage so hurriedly that the transformed teacher was knocked back to the floor of the small plastic cage.

Before he could make a second attempt at freeing himself from the confines of the collection cube, he heard the loud snap of plastic as Nathan secured the lid on the cage.

Moments later, holding the cage in his fingers, Nathan peered inside at the strange winged bug and the eight-legged spider that Jeremy had plucked out of the tall weeds.

"Make them do something," Jeremy said in a bored tone as he stared over the shoulder of his friend at the two multi-legged creatures in the cage.

"How do I do that?" Nathan asked.

"Shake the cage," Jeremy offered.

"No!" Ryan wanted to scream as he looked at the other side of the square prison cube. "Keep that monster away from me!"
1211221.title: Foiled Escape Attempt

choices: He looks for the way to the school building
While looking for help he his spotted by a hungry bird
1212.content:
Ryan saw his gigantic student open the lid on a small plastic cube. The lid was inter-spaced with thin plastic strips that allowed for decent air flow while still maintaining the captivity of any specimens held inside the cube.

If he got put into the collection cage, there was no way he would be able to free himself. He prepared himself as the boys proceeded with the transfer.

Jeremy reached into the net to pluck the interesting bug free of the mesh. Ryan surprised even himself when he managed to squirm free of the boy's dirty fingers and make a swift flight into the air.

"He's getting away," Nathan yelled.

Jeremy made another wild swing with the net, trying to recapture their prize specimen. Prepared this time, Ryan used his new wings to fly high out of reach.

He had gotten free, but now he was faced with a new dilemma.

The boys, who were his own students after all, represented a possible means for help with his mind-boggling problem of transformation into this strange bug.

But, as long as they remained intent on putting him inside a cage, he would have to avoid them.

Perhaps he should fly back to the school and seek help from the teachers and staff. or he could locate some of his other students participating in the field trip.

A twitch of his new wings sent him speeding over the tops of tall trees as he looked for…
1212.title: Ryan gets away

12123.content:
For the robin, the bug looked much like any other, except it flew erratically, which directed the bird's attention to it in the first place.

Easily using its much larger wings to overtake the flying insect, the bird opened its beak, snapping it closed an instant later, neatly and with surgical precision, removing one less insect from the circle of life.

Ryan barely had time to register what had happened.

Only a moment ago, he had been flying like his wings were becoming second nature to him. He veered in one direction, then veered off to another.

"I could get used to this..." The transformed teacher thought to himself, taking some joy in the novelty of his strange transformation.

Then the shadow overtook him. He reversed course only to see a bird, beak open wide, flying on an intercept course with...

"Me!" Ryan exclaimed. "It's after meeee...."

His terrified scream ended abruptly as the bird snapped him up in its beak and...
12123.title: While looking for help he his spotted by a hung...

121231.content:
The humongous bird opened its terrible beak wide, moving with unnatural precision for something so large.

Ryan glimpsed a reddish maw that seemed to surge forward as the beak snapped close in an instant.

The tiny bug that had been a human such a short while ago. He railed against the unfairness of it all.

Then the bird gulped, sending the bug down into a waiting stomach.
121231.title: Swallowed

choices: Kevin stomps the bug for the fun of it
Nathan or Jeremy come to the bug's aid
124.content:
"What's going on here?"

Kevin, the biggest, meanest bully in the eighth grade, pushed aside sixth-graders Nathan and Jeremy. Kevin, a hard-to-handle child, was a bully to most of the other kids and a challenge for all his teachers, including Ryan. Back when the boy had been in Ryan's sixth-grade class, his teacher had predicted that Kevin was eventually going to prove too much to handle.

Of course, the transformed young man hadn't ever imagine finding himself in such an alarming situation with the out-of-control 13-year-old boy. Now, the bug-man looked up at the terrifying student as the giant boy rushed closer.

"That's one weird bug," Kevin said.

"We saw it first," Nathan declared.

"It's ours," Jeremy backed him up.

"Well, what if I just stomp your stupid bug?" Kevin asked, and he lifted his sneaker.

Ryan felt a cold splash of terror as the emotion seized him like an invisible hand. He stared at the dirty sole of the boy's colossal sneaker. The tread held the shattered traces of other unfortunate bugs. Had those insects been stomped deliberately by the angry boy, or had Kevin even known of the havoc he was causing?

In his blind panic, Ryan froze. He forgot he had wings that could carry him to safety.

"No! You can't stomp me! I'm not a bug!"
124.title: Class Bully

choices: Falls out of tread and is noticed
1241.content:
Ryan's two students made weak protests but were not inclined to stand up to their long-time bully. They hated to lose the interesting specimen, but they didn't want to risk taking a beating at Kevin's hands.

Kevin laughed at the two younger boys when they whined their wimpy protests as he brought down his sneaker on the weird bug.

"You're both such a pair of babies," he said. "Whimpering about some dumb bug."

Nathan and Jeremy watched Kevin grind his sneaker back and forth in the tall grass as the bully made a thorough job of stomping on the only interesting bug they'd managed to find so far.

For their unfortunate teacher, the moment had been one of almost unspeakable terror as the giant boy's sneaker crashed down on him. He expected pain, and he experienced plenty of it. But the pain continued…

After a brief instant of darkness, bright light enveloped the transformed teacher as Kevin lifted his shoe. Although his body felt massively battered, he remained miraculously alive.

Realization dawned. Kevin had stomped him, but Ryan's insect body had managed to find itself wedged in the tread of the boy's sneaker.

It could very well prove to be a temporary reprieve. The frightened, confused man knew he needed a plan...
1241.title: Bully stomp

"Good bye bug!" Kevin raises his foot, but when he slams it down, you had moved away. "Shit!" He says.

Does he...

He can make his butt glow

13.title: Ryan shrinks

132.content:
He was flying but the blade of grass still towered above him. He had no idea how he was flying but his four wings beat automatically. It took him some time to figure out how to steer but then he took off.

He found a puddle so he could see his reflection. His face was still recognizable. He said, "Hello there" and even though his voice was not human, if anyone listened, they could understand him. He needed to find help.

But he heard the voice of Kevin and knew that if Kevin caught him, the first thing Kevin would do would be to rip his wings off. He couldn't afford to lose his wings when he's this tiny.
132.title: He is flying

choices: Oops! Kevin should have been a little less forceful
Kevin easily adds the stunned bug to a collection container
Kevin notices the bug has a face that looks like his teacher
1322.content:
Kevin thought the field trip was stupid and boring and spent most of his time, when not complaining sarcastically, with his arms folded across his chest and standing still, content to watch the younger boys in their silly chases after dumb insects.

His white tee shirt confused one little bug which didn't even see the approaching obstacle into it flew headlong into it. "Owww!" Ryan exclaimed. "What happened?"

The little bug-man hovered in front of Kevin's chest. Hovering a bit higher and tilting his head back, Ryan felt his blood freeze. "Oh no! Not Kevin!"

Kevin felt a tiny flying pest ping off his tee shirt and changed his mind. If the dumb bugs were going to throw themselves at him, he might as well collect one so the teacher wouldn't jump his ass.

He spread his hands apart, zeroed in on the hovering bug, and clapped his hands together.

Ryan heard a loud boom as the gigantic eighth grader brought his hands together.
1322.title: Not knowing where Kevin is, he flies straight i...

choices: the class trip is over and everyone heads home
14.content:
Nothing out of the ordinary today as Ryan gets off the ground. The day sure has been weird for him. With whatever that strange looking bug appearing around him, Ryan wonders if there are more around. That bug seemed rare, after all. It bit him and he had to hit it just in case it attacked anyone else. However it was bred, it sure looked like nothing in the books.
He has to go back to teach the kids while on the trip. At least everyone is having as much fun as possible. Looking at his arm, Ryan has yet to feel any problems going on in his body.

So far, everything is going well as his students are having fun. Jeremy and Danny appear to be having a contest on their own to see who can catch more than the others. Nathan is just trying to take photos of whatever bugs he can find to show to his cousins when they come over to his house. Some of the girls are doing the same, hoping to catch at least an impressive bug, a butterfly to draw one day, and just watching the others have their fun.

Right now, Ryan feels like he's doing his job well as he doesn't need to interfere much. Maybe later after heading home, he should go to the doctor and see if the bug bit might have done something to his body.
14.title: Ryan feels normal...for now

143.content:
The ride back to school on the bus with 20 screaming boys is an experience in itself.

Ryan would have blamed his headache on the noisy bus, but the dull, throbbing pain behind his eyes continued after he got off the bus and took a short break in the teacher's lounge before he left for home with a pack full of lesson plans and textbooks.

He had just poured himself a cup of coffee when Silas entered the lounge.

The tall man wore gray overalls and a form-fitting white tee shirt obscured by the gray straps of the overalls. He saw Ryan in the overstuffed armchair with his coffee.

"Sorry, I didn't know anyone was in here," Silas said and swept back his dark hair out of his eyes with the push of a hand.

Ryan winced from a sip of a coffee that tasted like the grounds had been fished from the garbage.

"Is it that bad?" Silas laughed and joked.

Ryan sipped again. "Yes," he concluded.

Silas busied himself with removing some small boxes from a bucket in his left hand. He stooped and wedged one of the boxes beneath a wheeled platform that held the room's decade-old microwave.

"What's that?" Ryan asked, covertly enjoying a view of Silas's ass beneath the overalls.

Silas straightened and put a finger over his mouth. "Shhhh, just between us," he said. "No need to cause a panic. It's just some roach traps."

"Roach traps?" Ryan echoed, feeling creeped out by even thinking of the scurrying, repulsive insects.

"I believe prevention's worth a pound of cure," Silas said.

Ryan nodded. In addition to the headache, he now experienced some vertigo and felt unsteady on his feet.

"Although, there's always the old-fashioned way of dealing with them." He lifted one of his work boots and pantomimed bringing it down with a resounding stomp on the lounge tiles.

The demonstration caused some queasy feelings in Ryan's stomach.

Silas reached over and gripped Ryan's shoulder. "You're looking a little green, Mr. Dalton."

"Please, it's Ryan," he said yet again, always embarrassed when the big hunk called him Mr. Dalton.

"Sure thing, man," Silas said and slipped one of the roach traps into Ryan's hand. "You mind shoving that under the fridge for me? I'll just take care of the boys locker room and leave you to relax."

"No, I don't mind," Ryan said.

Silas grinned and departed. Ryan got on his knees to wedge the small box beneath the teacher's lounge fridge when the room began to spin. He moaned and slumped onto the smooth, cool tiles.
143.title: Ryan feels strange

choices: Ryan panics and instinctively runs inside the darkness of the roach trap
Ryan tries to communicate his dilemma to Silas
1431.content:
When Ryan awoke, a gradual process of dawning awareness that he had not quite shaken that strange feeling, he noticed some strange changes.

The most readily apparent involved the altered scale of his surroundings. The furniture, the refrigerator, the table support a microwave, had taken on the dimensions of buildings.

"Why's everything look so big?" Ryan wondered aloud, only he didn't hear his voice.

He heard an odd, raspy noise that seemed produced any time he tried to speak.

He took a step back, which coincided with his first notice of the roach trap that loomed to his side like a dark, foreboding cave of black plastic.

Ryan tried to rub his eyes.

At the same moment, an insect raised its spiky forelimbs to its large, compound eyes. A tough exoskeleton encased his reddish-brown form.

Ryan wanted to scream.

He now had a relatively small head and a broad, flattened body divided into a segmented thorax and abdomen. Two very long, flexible antennae sprouted from his forehead. He tried to curse, which only set his mouthparts located on the underside of his head, to rasping again.

Although he now lived in a tidy apartment, he had lived in plenty of dumps. In that time, he had seen plenty of cockroaches.

"How?" Ryan groaned, or rather rasped, with his mouthparts.

He scurried across the tiles of the lounge.

His alert body picked up the vibration well ahead of the arrival of Silas.

Ryan froze in place as the gigantic custodian entered the lounge.
1431.title: Ryan changes into a cockroach

14313.content:
Silas's boots stomp against the tile floors as he walks in. The boots rise into the air high enough that Ryan can see the mangled bugs and insects that populate the treads. A shiver runs over Ryan's new exoskeleton.

Ryan considers jumping toward the door and scampers underneath the furniture in an effort to reach the opening. As Ryan crawls under a last chair however a spider descends from the edge of the chair. It bares its fangs on drops onto the cold tiles. It's 8 legs look like razor sharp spears and it's hairs look like barbs on a wire. Ryan immediately retreats. He goes into the open and retreats toward the cabinet next to the fridge(trying to avoid the trap). The spider follows into the open space. Ryan feels a sinking feeling of dread as well as exhaustion. He knows the spider will watch him. The spider bursts into a final leap—

*Stomp*

Silas's boot sits atop the spider. The boot is twisted and then dragged leaving a smear on the floor. Silas drops down and wipes up the smear with a napkin and Ryan feels immense relief.

"Let me check Ryan placed my trap", Silas speaks. He lowers his head to the ground and checks on the trap which causes Ryan's stomach to drop. The two lock eyes but Silas only sees a cockroach. Ryan's panics and doesn't know what to do while silas reaches with his gloved hand into the space below the cabinet.

Ryan bursts into a sprint and attempts to cross the open area and reach more concealing furniture on the other side.
"Fucking bug", Silas mumbles as he raises his boot.
14313.title: Silas sees a filthy roach

choices: Plucks the bug out of the glue and puts it back on the floor to finish his stomp
Leaves the roach trapped... it will help lure other roaches into the trap
Tosses trap and the roach into the trash
143132.content:
The poor teacher’s mind reeled. In the space of mere moments, a heavily-armored, terrifying spider had nearly claimed him as prey only for one of the janitor’s massive boots to crush the creature and grind its remains into a gruesome paste on the tiles.

Although Ryan felt an instant of relief at the obliteration of the fearsome predator, he almost immediately felt a chill to realize how near the giant had gotten— the same giant that had mercilessly stomped the spider.

He could almost have suffered whiplash… if he still had a recognizable neck instead of the stiff, armored thorax and abdomen of an insect. “I’ve got to hide!” Ryan realized.

Unfortunately, he heard a booming voice drop words form the heavens. “Let’s see if Ryan placed my trap…”

In that next instant, Silas locked his huge eyes on a loathsome bug, the most reviled of all household insect pests.


In a panicked burst, Ryan sprinted and attempted to cross the open area and reach a more secure hiding place.

His blundering only put him at peril.

"Fucking bug", Silas mumbled and raised the same boot that had taken out the spider.

Ryan froze as he looked up and saw the sole of the boot, plastered with the remains of not only the spider, but other insects. Silas obviously enjoyed the pest control aspect of his job.

“No, please,” Ryan prayed as the boot dropped.

And missed.

Unfortunately, the stomp produced a blast of displaced air that blew the transformed teacher into the very roach trap that Ryan had held in one hand earlier.

Silas looked and saw that the cockroach had gotten itself mired in the sticky glue inside the trap. He laughed and…
143132.title: Ryan avoids stomp only to get in a worse situation

1431321.content:
The transformed teacher watched as the custodian reached with a huge hand to grab the tiny trap in equally huge fingers.

The more Ryan struggled in the glue, the more mired in the sticky substance he became. The teacher, who had been planning a detailed study of insect anatomy, recognized a new peril. As he sank deeper into the sticky substance in the trap, the glue clogged the spiracles on each side of his insect abdomen. The tiny tubes, which carried air to his new form, clogged quickly with the thick glue as Ryan discovered that he was slowly suffocating.

Although he wished it wasn't the case, he knew nothing about Silas's background and upbringing. In particular, he didn't have a clue to the origins of the man's almost exuberant hatred for the pests that had plagued a difficult childhood growing up in various infested and squalid apartments. His upbringing made Silas a dedicated destroyer of insects.

The transformed teacher clacked his mouth-parts together. "Silas, help me," he cried wordlessly. "I can't breathe..."

Silas, not the least bit squeamish about handling bugs, responded by plucking the insect from the sticky trap.

"Thank you," Ryan rejoiced. "Thank you for..."

Suddenly, Silas turned the cockroach upside down and dunked its upper shell into the glue. He laughed as he then fixed the glue-coated roach upside down on the floor.

Ryan kicked all six legs in an effort to right his body. "Silas, no! What are you doing?"

Silas raised himself back up to his full height before he made one last survey of the bug squirming helplessly on the floor. "I could just have left you in the trap, but this will be more fun... for me!"

The giant raised once again one of his janitorial work boots.

Ryan screamed for mercy.

Instead of a sudden stomp, Silas pressed the sole of the boot gently against the hard carapace of the bug. He felt the resistance as he increased the weight on the roach's exoskeleton.

"You can't," the teacher screamed. "You mustn't! I'm not a bug!"

He felt the weight of the boot increase steadily.

"No!" Ryan repeated. "I'm not a bug!"

He began to hear his exoskeleton crack and pop as fissures formed at various pressure points.

"One less of you ugly bastards for the world to deal with," Silas spoke aloud and chuckled.

A watery, yellowish fluid seeped from the fissures as Ryan's new form slowly gave way to the inexorable pressure.

"I'm not a bug!" Ryan's plea became a mantra. "I'm not a..."

SPLAT!

The boot slammed down to the tiles when the resistant pressure of the cockroach's shell gave way.

Silas lifted the boot. Most of the shattered exoskeleton with its greenish guts, pale yellow blood, and assorted viscera remained on the floor, but some of the demolished remains adhered to the dirty sole of the boot.

Silas lowered the boot's sole back onto the floor and scraped it back and forth over the tiles, getting most of the loathsome goo off his boot. He used a dustpan and hand broom to scrape the rest of Ryan's remains off the tiles and dumped them into a trash can.

The community never figured out the reasons for the admired teacher's disappearance, but Silas did pause to remember the polite, uncoordinated, but handsome-in-his-own-way man. He never had any reason to connect the disappearance of Ryan Dalton with the cockroach that met its demise beneath his work boot.
1431321.title: No Mercy

info.brief_description: A teacher's class takes a field trip; a bug bite spells trouble for the teacher.
info.description:
Ryan Dalton, 32, a sixth-grade science teacher at an all-boys academy.

Students: Jeremy, Peter, Danny, Nathan, Roger and Corey.

Kevin, the bully in the eighth grade.

Silas Nordstrom, 28, a janitor at the school.

Kenneth Pendleton, the school's principal.

A strange bug bite during a field trip has weird consequences for a sixth-grade teacher. He turns into a bug!
